title: Finland’s Iceye secures Japanese contract as it advances international expansion, new satellite ranges
summary: ICEYE, a Finnish SAR constellation operator, signed a contract with Japan’s IHI Corporation to develop an Earth observation satellite constellation for security, civilian, and commercial use. The deal includes four satellites and an image acquisition system, with an option for 20 more. The first satellites are expected to begin operations in April 2026, operated by ICEYE’s Warsaw hub.
why_it_matters: This contract marks ICEYE’s expansion into the Japanese market and reinforces its position as a leading provider of SAR satellite technology. The deal also highlights ICEYE’s growth in international commercial and defense sectors, alongside its plans to diversify into optical and SIGINT satellites.
